channel.title: Startup not working for simple file playback patch
channel.description:
I asked basically the same question in another part of this forum, so forgive me... but I am really at a loss as to why my patch, which simply does looping playback of an audio file, isn't behaving when I try to run it at startup. [Here is the patch](https://www.dropbox.com/s/2trktn28v523xjp/loopingFilePlayback2.axp?dl=1), which has a play fn stereo going through a couple of paraEQs on its way to the audio out. Super simple. I also included pink noise just for testing purposes.
The patch runs fine in 'Live' mode and when I 'upload to SD card as startup' there are no errors reported. When I disconnect from USB and run the board off an external power supply, my patch runs -- I can verify that with the pink noise -- but the file playback doesn't start.
Can anyone tell me if there is a trick to starting the play fn upon startup? I tried using a loadbang with a delayedpulse to make sure that the playback started well after the Axoloti's startup but that didn't work.
Thanks for any suggestions... I assume that this is not a bug but it definitely is unexpected behaviour.

item.title: Startup not working for simple file playback patch
item.dc:creator: @mattr Matt Rogalsky
item.description:
@mattr wrote:

Ummm, I just figured out a solution, which was to copy my audio file to the root of the SD card. It wasn't being found in the subdirectory for my patch, for some reason.

Read full topic
item.source: Startup not working for simple file playback patch
